body.name: WiFi 6 Router, GNCC AX1800 WiFi Routers for Home, Dual Band Gigabit Wireless Router (Up to 1800 Gbps), Coverage up to 2000 sq. ft., 40 Devices, Parental Control
body.stockDetail: Only 3 left in stock - order soon.
deliveryMessages: FREE delivery Tuesday, February 20. Order within 13 hrs 2 mins
features: [Super fast internet speed] -- The router uses WiFi6 technology to provide you with a high-speed, stable and low-latency network, compatible with all US Internet Service Provider, if you want to get the maximum speed, please ensure that you have a broadband of more than 500M
[Easy Setup with App] -- The OSAIO APP allows you to easily set up the router. Just connect your Internet Ethernet cable to the router, and the app will guide you through simple setup steps

[Smart parental control] -- The OSAIO APP allows you to easily manage the content access and usage time of Internet devices. Use the app to set usage time limits, device schedules, filter websites, etc. for each connected device in your home
[Four Gigabit wired ports] -- 1G*4 port provides you with a fast and stable connection with computers, game boxes and other devices
[Advanced WPA3 Security] -- The latest WiFi encryption technology protects your device and network security. This technology is only equipped on wifi 6 routing system

💗【Warranty】24-Month Warranty,24-hour friendly customer support on weekdays and 48-hour customer support on weekends.If the email message is not answered in time, please don't worry, you can tell us through Amazon message.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on October 26, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Perfect for a room router for Quest 3 VR gaming!
reviews.reviewText: I set this router up using GNCC's router interface (192.168.8.1) via web browser to set it up for Access Point mode. After a few minutes of letting it load and then manually configuring it to how I wanted, I connected it to my main router and placed it in the same room as my desktop PC. I created a different 5GHz SSID to be specifically only used for my Quest 3 VR headset.I tested it out using the Oculus app to Airlink for PCVR, at 72hz, 1.5x resolution. It set the max fixed bandwidth the Oculus app allowed (200mbps). I started up SteamVR to play Valheim (VR mod + texture/mesh mods), and unlike before, I had no issues; it works perfectly now!Honestly for $35. Buying this was a no brainer, considering every other "new" Wifi 6 router I seen on Amazon right now is $75-300. I was happy to see that it had gigabit WAN and LAN ports to allow me to connect my desktop to it, getting the same speeds as my main router.EDIT: I did a performance test with the router to measure the bandwidth I was actually getting while using Virtual Desktop app on my Quest 3. I can confirm I was streaming a solid 1200Mbps from my desktop connected to the router, and from the router to my VR headset (5G Wi-Fi) with no obstructions up to 15 feet. Upon a second test, but with having three walls and an HVAC unit (metal object) about 45 feet from the router, I was still getting about 600-800Mbps. So I can personally say that its "up to 2000 sq ft" is accurately "as advertised".

reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Provides fast Internet
reviews.reviewText: Love the product it has some great features on the router management page and provides a fast internet connection.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 22, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Cheap wifi 6 Router, Good Range and Average Speed
reviews.reviewText: This is probably the cheapest wifi 6 router on Amazon. It covers my 2400 square ft home well.On the other hand, its speed is mediocre at best. I bought it to replace my TP-Link AC1700. I don't see much improvement of speed. I do have a couple of devices with wifi6 adapters. But their speeds remain the same.The web interface mostly works well, although it has some oddities. The interface switches between phone and PC randomly, regardless of which browser used (Chrome/Firefox/Edge). Also at the some places, the interface is confusing, e.g., the on-off buttons. It took me a while to find out how to turn a feature on and off.Also the smart integrated SSID feature behaves in a strange way. It seems to switch between 2.4G and 5G randomly for each client, regardless of how close the device is to the router.Overall, despite the flaws, it is a good router given the price.Update: I did a speed test. I connected this router (GNCC) and an old router (D-Link DIR-3040 triband AC 3000) both to my home server. Then I ran iperf tests from a laptop, located two rooms away, to the two routers. Here are the results:GNCC: 76/76 mbpsDIR-3040: 339/182 mbpsYou see that the old DLink is more than 4 times as fast as this one in download and 2 times as fast in upload.I bought the DLink in 2019. Even during that time, it is only a midrange wifi5 router. So this router is much slower than a 4-year old wifi5 router. Also, if your internet speed is over 100 mbps, this router might turn out to be a bottleneck.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 24, 2022
reviews.reviewTitle: 1.0 out of 5 stars Roulette for Internet
reviews.reviewText: This router kept going offline. My mother thought she accidentally did something to make it not work, so we paid a tech person to come check out everything as the home security system and other things rely on the home wi fi. After hours and hours of troubleshooting, the tech suggested mom replace the router. She did so reluctantly because this one is less than 6 months old. The new router was the answer.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on March 23, 2022
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Son set up and had running in minutes.
reviews.reviewText: My son's router finally went out, an older Netgear, saw this WPA3 device and decided to give it a shot for him to both upgrade the dated router and increase wireless speeds.He said it set up easily, used computer network interface to connect, and just used old SSID and passphrases so guests could stop over and not ask for credentials from my mother, whom my son lives with...All the previous devices connected, and getting faster speed than ISP is claiming, 320/313 when 300/300, not uncommon, but certainly not below. I can see their device from next door, it is not as strong as mine, but theirs is located on shelf that has wall with metal edging and the device would have to be moved to pass a similar signal.None of this is an issue as I do not need that wifi, and everything in their house works and has better speeds than before,Life is good, and no more complaints over slow speeds from my son who games insistently.I will go over and check out interface and see how it compares to mine and other routers, if it passes my standards I will not return to update, if it does not...

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on May 19, 2022
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Wanted the gigabit connection for VR, seems to work fine for that.
reviews.reviewText: I'm a bit slow when it comes to setting up routers and things, so essentially just pulled out my old one, put the new one in its place and ran the set up through my browser. Was pretty easy, although there were a few terms the interface threw at me that they didn't really explain well, but still got it up and running. Still got the same "no gigabit connection" warning in my Virtual Desktop app, so swapped out for another cable (completely forgot until just now as I'm typing this, that the new router actually came with a cat5 cable, I'd just swapped out the old for the new using all the existing cables), this time a Cat8, same issue, then figured out that to get the best connection, to connect the PC directly to the router with said Cat8 cable. Then the video on the item page explained how to make the connections for the rest of it. Ta-dah! No more error messages in Virtual Desktop. My first time using a non well known brand for my router, so I'm hanging on to my old one just in case, but so far it seems to be working fine.
